00057 //
00058 // Create the buffers
00059 //
00060 
00061 ring_t usart0_receive_ring;
00062 #define USART0_RECEIVE_BUFFER_LEN   64
00063 uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer[USART0_RECEIVE_BUFFER_LEN];
00064 
00065 ring_t usart0_transmit_ring;
00066 #define USART0_TRANSMIT_BUFFER_LEN  128
00067 uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer[USART0_TRANSMIT_BUFFER_LEN];
00068

00070 // JWP 6/16/11 flags for revised transmissio logic
00071 volatile uint8_t usart_tx_ready_flag;
00072 volatile uint8_t usart_buffered_tx_flag;

00089 //
00090 // Create some useful typdefs
00091 //
00092 
00093 typedef enum
00094 {
00095     usart_mode_asynchronous = 0,
00096     usart_mode_synchronous = 1
00097 } usart_mode_t;
00098 
00099 
00100 typedef enum
00101 {
00102     parity_none = 0,
00103         parity_even = 1,
00104     parity_odd = 2
00105 } usart_parity_t;
00106 
00107 typedef enum
00108 {
00109         baud_1200 = 1200,
00110         baud_2400 = 2400,
00111         baud_4800 = 4800,
00112         baud_9600 = 9600,
00113         baud_19200 = 19200,
00114         baud_38400 = 38400,
00115         baud_57600 = 57600 // 3/17/11 JWP
00116 } usart_baud_t;
00117 
00118 // JWP 3/21/11
00119 typedef enum
00120 {
00121     bit5 = 5,
00122     bit6 = 6,
00123     bit7 = 7,
00124         bit8 = 8,
00125         bit9 = 9
00126 } usart_databits_t;
00127 
00128 typedef enum
00129 {
00130         stopbit1 = 1,
00131         stopbit2 = 2
00132 } usart_stopbits_t;     
00133 
00134 typedef enum
00135 {
00136     flow_none = 0,
00137     flow_sw = 1,
00138     flow_hw = 2
00139 } usart_flow_control_t;
00140 
00141 typedef struct
00142 {
00143     usart_flow_control_t flow_control;
00144     uint8_t flow_out;
00145     uint8_t flow_in;
00146 } usart_flow_t;
00147 
00148 typedef struct
00149 {
00150     usart_baud_t baud;
00151     usart_parity_t parity;
00152     usart_flow_control_t flow_control;
00153 } usart_port_settings_t;

00161 /*!
00162         \defgroup usart USART Drivers
00163 */
00164 /**
00165         \ingroup usart
00166 
00167         \brief intializes the uart parameters
00168 
00169         \param mode 
00170         \code
00171         typedef enum
00172         {
00173             usart_mode_asynchronous = 0,
00174             usart_mode_synchronous = 1
00175         } usart_mode_t;
00176         \endcode
00177 
00178         \param baud
00179         \code
00180         typedef enum
00181         {
00182             baud_1200 = 1200,
00183             baud_2400 = 2400,
00184             baud_4800 = 4800,
00185             baud_9600 = 9600,
00186             baud_19200 = 19200,
00187             baud_38400 = 38400,
00188                 baud_57600 = 57600 // 3/17/11 JWP
00189         } usart_baud_t;
00190         \endcode
00191         
00192         \param freq_cpu uint32_t value used to calculate the baud rate parameters
00193         
00194         \param databits uint8_t Number of data bits
00195         \code
00196         typedef enum
00197         {
00198             5-bit = 5,
00199             6-bit = 6,
00200             7-bit = 7,
00201                 8-bit = 8,
00202                 9-bit = 9
00203         } usart_databits_t;
00204         \endcode
00205         
00206 
00207         \param stopbits uint8_t Number of stop bits
00208         \code
00209         typedef enum
00210         {
00211             1-stopbit = 1,
00212             2-stopbit = 6,
00213         } usart_stopbits_t;     
00214         \endcode
00215 
00216         \param parity
00217         \code
00218         typedef enum
00219         {
00220             parity_none = 0,
00221                 uparity_even = 1,
00222             uparity_odd = 2
00223         } usart_parity_t;
00224         \endcode
00225 
00226         \param flow_control
00227         \code
00228         typedef enum
00229         {
00230             flow_none = 0,
00231             flow_sw = 1,
00232             flow_hw = 2
00233         } usart_flow_control_t;
00234         \endcode
00235 */
00236 void usart0_init(uint32_t baud, uint32_t freq_cpu, usart_mode_t mode, usart_databits_t databits, usart_stopbits_t stopbits, usart_parity_t parity, usart_flow_control_t flow_control);
00237 
00238 /**
00239         \ingroup usart
00240 
00241         \brief intializes the uart the baudrate and parameters with defaults: 
00242          8 data bits, no parity, one stop bit, and no handshaking
00243 
00244 
00245         \param baud
00246         \code
00247         typedef enum
00248         {
00249             baud_1200 = 1200,
00250             baud_2400 = 2400,
00251             baud_4800 = 4800,
00252             baud_9600 = 9600,
00253             baud_19200 = 19200,
00254             baud_38400 = 38400,
00255                 baud_57600 = 57600 // 3/17/11 JWP
00256         } usart_baud_t;
00257         \endcode
00258 
00259 
00260 */
00261 void usart0_init_baud(uint32_t baud);
00262 
00263 /** 
00264         \ingroup usart
00265 
00266         \brief  Restores registers to datasheet default valuse
00267 
00268         Example:
00269         \code
00270         // Stop the madness
00271         usart0_uninit();
00272         \endcode
00273 
00274 */
00275 void usart0_uninit(void);

00280 
00281 /** \ingroup usart
00282 
00283     \brief Initiates the interrupt based transmission of the buffer
00284          NOTE: All of the put or insert function only load a byte into the transmission buffer.
00285          This function must be called to start the transmission.
00286 
00287         Example:
00288         \code
00289         // Put a string from program memory into the transmit buffer
00290         usart0_put_pgm_string(pgm_str1);
00291         // Initiate buffer transmission
00292         usart0_send();
00293         \endcode
00294 */
00295 void usart0_send(void);
00296 
00297 
00298 /** \ingroup usart
00299 
00300     \brief Gets the receive buffer count
00301         This can be used as a boolean since if the buffer is empty it returns 0.
00302 
00303         Example:
00304         \code
00305         char *c;
00306 
00307         if(usart0_available())
00308         {
00309                 if(usart0_get_char(c)) usart0_put_char(*c);
00310                 usart0_send(); // Starts buffer tansmission
00311         }
00312         \endcode
00313          
00314     \return receive buffer count.
00315 */
00316 bool usart0_available(void);
00317 
00318 
00319 /** \ingroup usart
00320 
00321     \brief Puts a character into the usart transmit buffer.
00322 
00323         \code
00324         char *c;
00325         
00326         if(usart0_get_char(c)) usart0_put_char(*c);
00327         \endcode
00328          
00329     \param c the char to be sent.
00330 
00331 */
00332 void usart0_put_char(char c);
00333 
00334 /** \ingroup usart
00335 
00336     \brief Gets a character from the usart receive buffer.
00337 
00338         \code
00339         char *c;
00340         
00341         if(usart0_get_char(c)) usart0_put_char(*c);
00342         \endcode
00343 
00344          
00345         \param *c pointer to a character to put the buffer value
00346 
00347     \return character from the buffer
00348 
00349 */
00350 bool usart0_get_char(char *c);
00351 
00352 /** \ingroup usart
00353 
00354     \brief Puts a uint8_t byte into the usart transmit buffer.
00355 
00356         \code
00357         uint8_t *b;
00358 
00359         if(usart0_get_byte(b)) usart0_put_byte(*b);
00360         \endcode
00361 
00362          
00363     \param b the  to be sent.
00364 
00365 */
00366 void usart0_put_byte(uint8_t b);
00367 
00368 /** \ingroup usart
00369 
00370     \brief Gets a uint8_t byte from the usart receive buffer.
00371         
00372         \param *b pointer to a uint8_t byte to put the buffer value
00373 
00374     \return uint8_t byte from the buffer
00375 
00376         \code
00377         uint8_t *b;
00378 
00379         if(usart0_get_byte(b)) usart0_put_byte(*b);
00380         \endcode
00381          
00382 
00383 */
00384 bool usart0_get_byte(uint8_t *b);
00385 
00386 
00387 /** \ingroup usart
00388 
00389     \brief Puts a '\0' terminated string into the transmit buffer.
00390         To prevent buffer overrun, the string is automatically truncated 
00391         with '\0'if it exceeds USART0_TRANSMIT_BUFFER_LEN - 1.
00392          
00393         \param *str pointer to a char buffer 
00394 
00395 */
00396 void usart0_put_string(char *str); 
00397 
00398 
00399 /*!     
00400         \brief Loads a string from program memory into the transmit buffer.
00401         
00402         \param pointer to a constant character string
00403 
00404         Example:
00405         \code
00406         // Define string outside any function
00407         const char pgm_str1[] PROGMEM =  "This is a program memory string defined outside any function.\r";
00408         ...
00409         // Put the program memory string into the transmit buffer
00410         usart0_put_pgm_string(pgm_str1);
00411         // Transmit it
00412         usart0_send();
00413 
00414         // Use with a string intialized in the function
00415         usart0_put_pgm_string(PSTR("This is a program memory string using PSTR within a function.\r"));
00416         usart0_send();
00417 
00418         \endcode
00419 
00420 */ 
00421 void usart0_put_pgm_string(const char *); 
00422 
00423 
00424 /** 
00425         \ingroup usart
00426 
00427         \brief This clear function will reset the transmit buffer head_index
00428         and tail_index to 0. The count value is also set to 0. A memset command 
00429         is used to reset a particular area in memory as well.
00430 
00431         Example:
00432         \code
00433         void end_this()
00434         {
00435                 usart0_transmit_buffer_clear();
00436         }
00437         \endcode
00438 
00439 */
00440 void usart0_transmit_buffer_clear(void);
00441 
00442 /** 
00443         \ingroup usart
00444 
00445         \brief Adds the byte 'c' to the transmit buffer and returns
00446         True if it was able to add the byte, False otherwise.
00447   
00448     \note Data added will be one value less than the size
00449     of the defined receive buffer. An example of this is a buffer
00450     size of [10] will only allow 9 values to be added into the buffer
00451         
00452         Example:
00453         \code
00454         \\ Add a string termination character
00455         usart0_transmit_buffer_insert('\0');
00456         \endcode
00457 
00458         \param c byte to add
00459         \return boolean result of attempt to add byte
00460         
00461 */
00462 bool usart0_transmit_buffer_insert(uint8_t c);
00463 
00464 
00465 /** \ingroup usart
00466 
00467     \brief Data is retreived from the transmit buffer. Upon
00468     retrieval, the buffer index is decremented.
00469 
00470         Example:
00471         \code
00472         char c;
00473 
00474         c = usart0_transmit_buffer_remove();
00475         \endcode
00476 
00477     \return tail data byte
00478 */
00479 uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_remove(void);
00480 
00481 /** \ingroup usart
00482 
00483     \brief Gets the transmit buffer count
00484          
00485         Example:
00486         \code
00487         if(usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count())// Is there data in the buffer?
00488         {
00489                 // Send next byte in the buffer.
00490               UART_DATA_REG = ring_remove(&usart0_transmit_ring);
00491         }
00492         \endcode
00493 
00494     \return Transmit buffer count.
00495 */
00496 uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count(void);
00497 
00498 /** 
00499         \ingroup usart
00500 
00501         \brief Transmit buffer counter initialization
00502 
00503         Example:
00504         \code
00505         uint8_t free;
00506 
00507         free = usart0_transmit_buffer_free_count();     
00508         \endcode
00509 
00510         \return Transmit buffer size minus receive buffer count
00511 */
00512 uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_free_count(void);
00513 
00514 /** 
00515         \ingroup usart
00516 
00517         \brief Looks at a number of bytes of data in the transmit buffer
00518 
00519         Example:
00520         \code
00521         uint8_t myBuf[10];
00522         uint8_t toGet = 10;
00523         uint8_t got = 0;
00524 
00525         got = usart0_transmit_buffer_peek(myBuf, toGet);
00526         if(got != get)
00527         {
00528                 \\ didn't get requested bytes
00529         }
00530         else
00531         }
00532                 \\got requested bytes 
00533                 ...
00534         }
00535         \endcode
00536 
00537         \param *buf pointer a buffer to hold the bytes requested
00538         \param count The number of bytes to look at.
00539 
00540         \return Total bytes read
00541 */
00542 uint8_t usart0_transmit_buffer_peek(uint8_t *buf, uint8_t count);
00543 
00544 /** 
00545         \ingroup usart
00546 
00547         \brief  Looks at the tail byte of data in the Transmit buffer
00548         
00549         Example:
00550         \code
00551         uint8_t peekByte = 0;
00552 
00553         peekByte = usart0_transmit_peek();
00554         \endcode
00555 
00556         \return Transmit buffer tail byte
00557 */
00558 uint8_t usart0_transmit_peek(void);
00559 
00560 
00561 /** 
00562         \ingroup usart
00563 
00564         \brief This clear function will reset the receive buffer head_index
00565         and tail_index to 0. The count value is also set to 0. A memset command 
00566         is used to reset a particular area in memory as well.
00567 
00568         Example:
00569         \code
00570         void end_this()
00571         {
00572                 usart0_receive__buffer_clear();
00573         }
00574         \endcode
00575 
00576 */
00577 void usart0_receive_buffer_clear(void);
00578 
00579 
00580 /** \ingroup usart
00581 
00582     \brief Data is retreived from the receive buffer. Upon
00583     retrieval, the buffer index is decremented.
00584 
00585     \return tail data byte
00586 
00587         Example:
00588         \code
00589         \\ Remove a byte from the receive buffer and put it in the transmit buffer
00590         sart0_transmit_buffer_insert(usart0_receive_buffer_remove());
00591         \endcode
00592 
00593 */
00594 uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_remove(void);
00595 
00596 /** \ingroup usart
00597 
00598     \brief Gets the receive buffer count
00599 
00600     \return receive buffer count.
00601 
00602         Example:
00603         \code
00604         while(1)
00605                 // Ping back received values
00606                 if(usart0_available())
00607                 {
00608                         count = usart0_receive_buffer_inuse_count();
00609 
00610                         for(int i = 0 ; i < count; i++)
00611                         {
00612                                 usart0_transmit_buffer_insert(usart0_receive_buffer_remove());
00613                         }       
00614                         usart0_send();          
00615                 }
00616         }
00617         \endcode
00618          
00619 */
00620 uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_inuse_count(void);
00621 
00622 /** 
00623         \ingroup usart
00624 
00625         \brief Receive buffer counter initialization
00626 
00627         Example:
00628         \code
00629         uint8_t free;
00630 
00631         free = usart0_receive_buffer_free_count();      
00632         \endcode
00633 
00634         \return receive buffer size minus receive buffer count
00635 */
00636 uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_free_count(void);
00637 
00638 /** 
00639         \ingroup usart
00640 
00641         \brief Looks at a number of bytes of data in the receive buffer
00642 
00643         Example:
00644         \code
00645         uint8_t peekByte = 0;
00646 
00647         peekByte = usart0_receive_peek();
00648         \endcode
00649 
00650         \param *buf pointer a buffer to hold the bytes requested
00651         \param count The number of bytes to look at.
00652 
00653         \return Total bytes read
00654 */
00655 uint8_t usart0_receive_buffer_peek(uint8_t *buf, uint8_t count);
00656 
00657 
00658 // These functions are used by API functions but not exposed in the API
00659 void usart0_buffer_clear(ring_t *ring);
00660 bool usart0_buffer_insert(ring_t *ring, uint8_t c);
00661 uint8_t usart0_buffer_remove(ring_t *ring);
00662 uint8_t usart0_buffer_inuse_count(ring_t *ring);
00663 uint8_t usart0_buffer_peek(ring_t *ring, uint8_t *buf, uint8_t count);
00664 uint8_t usart0_buffer_free_count(ring_t *ring);
